Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: Ja'Markis Weston
entry.content: ... that one sportswriter said: "If Dr. Frankenstein could construct a football player, Ja'Markis Weston would emerge from the lab"?

entry.title: Saru
entry.content: ... that Doug Jones considered retiring from creature-acting work until being offered the role of Saru on Star Trek: Discovery?

entry.title: Reinhard Höhn
entry.content: ... that Nazi officer Reinhard Höhn founded a business school after the Second World War?

entry.title: Yuki Wakai
entry.content: ... that Yuki Wakai gave up her dream to be a singer-songwriter to become an idol singer, only to later become a singer-songwriter?

entry.title: Hostage
entry.content: ... that Hostage, a book written by Eli Sharabi after surviving 491 days in Hamas captivity, became the fastest-selling book in Hebrew-language publishing history?

entry.title: Mentsuyu Hitori Meshi
entry.content: ... that the manga series Mentsuyu Hitori Meshi has recipes on cooking with mentsuyu?

entry.title: 2025 Enderlin tornado
entry.content: ... that the 2025 Enderlin tornado threw train cars nearly twice as far as required to qualify for the highest intensity tornado rating?

entry.title: Winter Kept Us Warm
entry.content: ... that the cast of the 1965 film Winter Kept Us Warm were not told about its queer subject matter?

entry.title: blue lace agate
entry.content: ... that most blue lace agate (example pictured) was sourced from a single mine in Namibia until 2017?
